utterance.speaker: STARK
utterance.content: It's... cold.

utterance.speaker: STARK
utterance.content: Good. Thank you.

utterance.speaker: STARK
utterance.content: There's a new girl at the ice-cream store. She doesn't seem too fond of buttoning her top button. Let's go check her out.

utterance.speaker: COLE
utterance.content: What are we supposed to be doing? It's almost four.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Tchah! You got someplace to be?

utterance.speaker: TWIN 15B
utterance.content: We know he likes to manipulate people. He's probably testing us.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: To find out what? How long we can look stupid for?

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: He said he'd be here by three; he's obviously not coming.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: I'm going home.

utterance.speaker: COLE
utterance.content: Nobody follow her. She Pied-Piper'ed nine people right out of a job last week.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Would you mind holding my metaphor for a second?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: New patient. Thirty-seven-year-old male, suffers from severe ascending muscle weakness.

utterance.speaker: COLE
utterance.content: Why are you late?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: To see who'd put up with it.

utterance.speaker: COLE
utterance.content: So, you mean if we'd left, we'd have been fired?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: No, I was going to fire everyone who stuck around. But since everyone stuck around....

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Twenty-eight percent curvature of the spine has caused reduced lung capacity, and he has reduced bone mineral density.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: Patient has Spinal Muscular Atrophy. It's genetic. Incurable. This is not a diagnostic mystery.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You have just given state secrets to the enemy.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: What enemy?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: New patient. New rules.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Today you're going to split yourselves into two teams.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: The first to figure out what's threatening to deprive the patient of the twenty or so miserable years he's got left with SMA gets to keep their jobs. Take off your numbers. You look stupid.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: And I think I know who you are by now.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Wait. How do you want us to split up?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Good question, Overly Excited Former Foster Kid. There's ten of you. I was thinking... six against six? No, wait...

utterance.speaker: TWIN 15B
utterance.content: How about Women versus Men?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Excellent suggestion, Fat Twin. More interesting than Evens versus Odds, less interesting than Shirts against Skins.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: If your sex organs dangle, you're the Confederates. If your sex organs are aesthetically pleasing, you're the Yanks.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: Dr. House?

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: I'd like to be on the men's team.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Do your sex organs dangle, Cutthroat Bitch?

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: Not yet.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: You've never hired more than one female on your team before.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: If you're going to purge an entire gender, it isn't going to be the danglers.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Sounds logical. If you don't think about it for more than three seconds. But I just told you that if the danglers lose, they're out.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: So, I can only assume you're hiding the real reason.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You don't think the women will be aggressive enough, will be good enough at science. They'll be too emotional.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: Can I switch teams?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: If the danglers are okay, I'm okay.

utterance.speaker: DOBSON
utterance.content: We're not okay.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: I get it. You don't like me because maybe I'm a little bit... competitive.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Manipulative.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Cutthroat Bitch is your official title.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: It's a game. You can either play for fun or play to win. If you want to win, you want cutthroat.

utterance.speaker: COLE
utterance.content: No, thank you.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: First thing we have to do is get inside his head.

utterance.speaker: JODY
utterance.content: It's not psychological.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: Not talking about the patient. Talking about House. He's insane, but he's not irresponsible. He wouldn't be playing this game if he didn't already know the answer.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: First thing we do is gang-bang the sucker. There's five of us. We can run dozens of tests. We don't need a theory; we just need brute force.

utterance.speaker: TWIN 15B
utterance.content: What about the assist dog? Picks bacteria-infested things up with its bacteria-infested mouth, hands them over to the guy and...

utterance.speaker: JODY
utterance.content: It's not the dog. Wouldn't be fair.

utterance.speaker: TWIN 15A
utterance.content: To who?

utterance.speaker: JODY
utterance.content: Whom. The men.

utterance.speaker: JODY
utterance.content: House knows I used to be a vet. If the dog's the answer, they'd be at a handicap.

utterance.speaker: COLE
utterance.content: What about the dog? Assist dogs put everything in their mouths...

utterance.speaker: COLE
utterance.content: ...money, doorknobs....

utterance.speaker: BRENNAN
utterance.content: Great.

utterance.speaker: COLE
utterance.content: That's not what I said. Why'd you think of low sodium?

utterance.speaker: BRENNAN
utterance.content: I don't.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Patient took a trip to Thailand two weeks ago. Hey, write bigger and angle the board more so they can see it.

utterance.speaker: COLE
utterance.content: This is wrong.

utterance.speaker: BRENNAN
utterance.content: It's only wrong if they cheat off us, and if they cheat off us, they're wrong.

utterance.speaker: DOBSON
utterance.content: They're not cheating. One of them is moving....

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Hey! Stop playing with your sutures or I'll have to redo them.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: Why do you guys keep a 'D' cell battery in a urine specimen cup?

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Because we pulled it from a patient's intestine.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: Why would somebody swallow a battery?

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Why do you assume it was swallowed? Bed 5 needs a bag of Ringer's Lactate.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: Would have been worse if he'd used a 9-volt.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Who said it was a 'he'?

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: False assumptions. You're good. You're trying to get me to think like him.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: And you're trying to kiss my ass. Why are you talking to me?

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: Because House is turning patient care into a game. It's dangerous. The patient's going to suffer - maybe die.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Wow! You really need a shave.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You see what I did there.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Whoa.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Interesting.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Need a crash cart in here!

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I didn't do it.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: When a person faints, it's because they're not getting enough blood to their brain. The act of falling corrects the problem. You faint again strapped into that power chair where you can't fall, you might not wake up.

utterance.speaker: STARK
utterance.content: Killed by an assistive device. At least my death would be ironic.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: I think when you went to Thailand you picked up a threadworm called Strongyloides. They usually go up through your feet.

utterance.speaker: STARK
utterance.content: I didn't do a lot of walking on the beach.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: But I assume you did have someone lay you down in the sand. Bare back, bare legs - increases exposure tenfold over bare feet.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: Two pills. You'll be all better.

utterance.speaker: STARK
utterance.content: Can I have some water for those, please?

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: Hey! Take a number.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: House didn't say anything about taking turns. What's she testing you for?

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: Don't. They'll spend all day obsessing over my idea instead of coming up with one of their own.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: But hey, I might be wrong.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Seriously. I'm worried that if we don't know what she's given you, there could be conflicts.

utterance.speaker: STARK
utterance.content: No, you're not. House told me. He's keeping track of all that. Ten doctors. I should be getting ten cures.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: We need blood, hair, and stool. You poop, and then you use the wooden sticks to collect the fecal matter and you rub it on the green box.

utterance.speaker: STARK
utterance.content: Why don't you hand it to my dog? Only one of us thinks I can do it on my own, and the last couple of days, I haven't even been doing that.

utterance.speaker: STARK
utterance.content: Ow!

utterance.speaker: BRENNAN
utterance.content: Is it all right with you if we carry you into the bathroom?

utterance.speaker: STARK
utterance.content: If you want me there, that's the way you're going to have to do it.

utterance.speaker: BRENNAN
utterance.content: Ready?

utterance.speaker: STARK
utterance.content: Mmm-hmm.

utterance.speaker: BRENNAN
utterance.content: One, two, three.

utterance.speaker: STARK
utterance.content: Can I get a little head support please?

utterance.speaker: STARK
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Why are you here?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: My offices are being used by my teams.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Teams?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Which means this is the only place where you can yell at me.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: You have team-s?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Two of them. I wanted to deal with the yelling today because I noticed what you were wearing and I wouldn't have to listen all that closely.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: You can't make a competition out of patient care.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Without competition, we'd still be single-celled organisms. Can I go now?

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Not until after the yelling. What's wrong with him?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I have seven of the finest minds on it, along with three very special...

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: You wouldn’t be doing this unless you already knew.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Ah. I tell you; you tell them; game's over.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: If you know, you are OBLIGATED to treat...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Well, then, in that case... I don't know.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Why would a guy voluntarily shove a metal object into an electrical socket?

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: I'm getting closer and closer to knowing the answer. What would happen if I shut down this game?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I'd fire them all, hire forty new fellowship applicants, start the game all over again.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: You DO know what's wrong with him, right?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: It'd be pretty irresponsible if I didn't, wouldn't it?

utterance.speaker: FEMALE FELLOW
utterance.content: Antibiotics aren't working.

utterance.speaker: HANDSOME FELLOW
utterance.content: Legionella could explain the lungs, the fever.

utterance.speaker: LATINO FELLOW
utterance.content: If she had Legionella, she'd have low sodium.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: What can you tell me about HER?

utterance.speaker: FEMALE FELLOW
utterance.content: She likes bodysurfing.

utterance.speaker: HANDSOME FELLOW
utterance.content: Maybe picked up a virus swimming off Johns Beach.

utterance.speaker: FEMALE FELLOW
utterance.content: But she doesn't even have the energy to finish her crossword any more.

utterance.speaker: LATINO FELLOW
utterance.content: Her boyfriend said...

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: That's it!

utterance.speaker: HANDSOME FELLOW
utterance.content: What is?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Blurry vision!

utterance.speaker: LATINO FELLOW
utterance.content: How do you get blurry vision from not being...

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: You don't stop a daily ritual that cures boredom because you're bored. She stopped doing her crossword puzzle because she's having a hard time reading it. What causes fever, boggy lungs, and blurry vision?

utterance.speaker: HANDSOME FELLOW
utterance.content: Fungal. Aspergillus would explain the pneumonia, which explains the fever.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Start her on amphotericin.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Hey, guys! Great job.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: If you're going to try to take yourself out, why choose electricity? You'd eat a bullet or jump off a building...

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: I love the 'team' thing, by the way.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: ...bury yourself alive in Cuddy's cleavage.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Teamwork. Collaboration. All for the greater good....

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: It could have been a suicidal gesture, as opposed to an actual attempt.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Interestingly, the rain in Spain doesn't actually fall in the plain all that much.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Who puts their internal organs on a skillet just to get attention?

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Go ask him.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Well, that would be cheating.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: Got a diagnosis yet?

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Get out of here.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: Got a stool sample yet?

utterance.speaker: COLE
utterance.content: How could you know?

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: Oh, I talked to a nurse. Pretty brilliant, hunh? I give you a move House will love, straight from one of his former fellows, and you let me join your team.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: You're too late. We already have our diagnosis.

utterance.speaker: COLE
utterance.content: He's lying because he wants you to go away. So do I.

utterance.speaker: BRENNAN
utterance.content: How do we know you're not a double agent? Find out what we're thinking, then go back to the women?

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: Because I don't care what you're thinking. You want to know why I want to be on your team? Because you're idiots. If I can get the women out of the competition, I'm in. And so are two of you.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: So. What's the big move?

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: It's called xenodiagnosis.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: We let these bugs bite you, and then we test their feces for parasites.

utterance.speaker: STARK
utterance.content: Why can't you test my feces?

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Because you've been chugging milk of magnesia for the past hour. You got a lot going in and nothing coming out.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: Testing the bugs' feces is actually more accurate than testing yours. Smaller haystack, easier to find the needle.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Get the bugs off. Get the bugs OFF him!

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: The test isn't done.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: He's choking.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Patchy infiltrates on the x-ray. Patient improved with chest PT and oxygen, consistent with aspiration.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: So now we have another symptom to explain - why does his throat think his lungs are his stomach?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: And why are your throats closing up?

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: Shouldn't we be in separate rooms?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: If you think I'm going to run two differentials at this time of the morning.... Grumpy, you're first.

utterance.speaker: BRENNAN
utterance.content: I'm not grumpy.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Why would I call you that if you weren't?

utterance.speaker: BRENNAN
utterance.content: It's an unusual combination. Unusual equals exotic, equals foreign. Has to be connected to his trip to Thailand.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You practice medicine overseas?

utterance.speaker: BRENNAN
utterance.content: I was with Doctors without Borders for eight years.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Ta-da!

utterance.speaker: BRENNAN
utterance.content: It's in my file.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: David Blaine hides the six of hearts in a beer bottle, it's still impressive.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You like exotic. Why are you here?

utterance.speaker: BRENNAN
utterance.content: I want this job.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Parents sick?

utterance.speaker: BRENNAN
utterance.content: No. I... I just...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: This is not the job you want. This is the job in the ZIP code you want. You engaged?

utterance.speaker: BRENNAN
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Ta-da!

utterance.speaker: BRENNAN
utterance.content: Am I not allowed to grow up and change my priorities?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You're allowed to. People usually don't.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: This is not a new symptom. Our patient has Spinal Muscular Atrophy. He has documented trouble swallowing. The choking is not new.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: So if it's nothing new, what caused the old?

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: Strongyloides worms explain the fainting. We already treated...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: So, he's all better, Woman Who... Thirteen.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: Hasn't gotten any worse.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: That's a pretty passive approach for the daughter of an alcoholic.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: Wrong again.

utterance.speaker: TWIN 15A
utterance.content: We could stress his system. Put him on a tilt table. If he stays conscious, it means we made the right diagnosis and we win.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Then why haven't you?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Six against four. One of the men is going to have to join the women's team.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: On the other hand, one of the men isn't an actual doctor, so... I guess it's pretty fair.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Men, you're in the penalty box.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Who's not the doctor?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I'm glad you asked about that.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Reason I'm penalizing you is time management.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: In Diagnostics, you're always working against the clock. The women came up with a theory and they treated the patient. You guys just sat around in a lab, hoping a series of blind tests would GIVE you a theory. You wasted the patient's time. Now I'm going to waste yours.

utterance.speaker: HANDSOME FELLOW
utterance.content: Her gums are turning yellow.

utterance.speaker: LATINO FELLOW
utterance.content: Whatever it is, it's in her liver now.

utterance.speaker: FEMALE FELLOW
utterance.content: Fungal fit perfectly.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: We were wrong.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: And we're going to keep being wrong until we're right.

utterance.speaker: LATINO FELLOW
utterance.content: Or until she dies.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Yeah, that was very helpful. Need a team to tell me we're mortals. Look, I'm sorry. You're right. Doesn't hurt to be reminded that we're dealing with the real stakes here. Liver failure's a bad thing, but it's also a clue. What does it tell us?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Can't let you leave if they think you're still... suicidal.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: No, that's right. You were just trying to kill the wall. I check this box, and your next roommates are gonna be Jesus and Crazy McLoonyBin. That guy never had a chance.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Suddenly you're shy? You pooped your pants in front of me. It's one of the nasty side effects of dying.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Okay. Here's what happened. Your oxygen-deprived brain was shutting down. A flood of endorphins and serotonin was released. That's what gave you the visions.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Nope.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Who the hell isn't a doctor?

utterance.speaker: COLE
utterance.content: House said we can't talk.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: He meant we can't talk about the case.

utterance.speaker: DOBSON
utterance.content: House is just jerking us around. That's what he does.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: You're not curious? There's only one reason you wouldn't be curious.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: We should talk about the case. He's punishing us for wasting time, maybe we shouldn't be wasting this time.

utterance.speaker: BRENNAN
utterance.content: Close that door. You're going to get us all fired.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: We need to find a link between fainting and trouble swallowing.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: We need to know if it's dysphagia or full-blown achalasia.

utterance.speaker: DOBSON
utterance.content: Paraganglioma.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: How would a neoplastic growth in his abdomen...

utterance.speaker: DOBSON
utterance.content: Not his abdomen. In his neck. A carotid body tumor causes trouble swallowing. Food presses against the vagus nerve, and causes the fainting.

utterance.speaker: COLE
utterance.content: So, if this guy has CANCER, we get to keep our jobs? And if he's healthy, we're fired.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: We need the CT to prove it.

utterance.speaker: BRENNAN
utterance.content: And we need the women not to figure it out while we're sitting here.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: And does House's computer have a built-in microphone?

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: There is a potential toxicity with the experimental treatment....

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: I was never here.

utterance.speaker: JODY
utterance.content: Blood pressure is remaining stable through 60 degrees.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: No pauses on his EKG, no nausea. The treatment worked.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: I need our patient.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: Syncope's cured, Amber. It's over.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: You obviously haven't stressed his system hard enough.

utterance.speaker: JODY
utterance.content: You crank that thing high enough, anyone will pass out.

utterance.speaker: STARK
utterance.content: This is incredible! This is the most I've moved in twenty years!

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: The tilt table test showed that the patient's EKG, BP, and pulse were made normal, despite considerable...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Who are you, Thirteen?

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: My name's in the file.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: The fact that you won't answer my questions tells me more about you than answers could.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: No, it doesn't. We turned the thing up to 95 degrees...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Do you think that non-answers tell me anything?

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: Sure. Just not as much as actual answers. That's why they are called answers.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Tell me you're hiding something.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: Tells you I'm hiding everything.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Tells me you've got something worth hiding. Some Turkish prison, gay porn... ya killed a man just because he was asking too many questions.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: Can I finish reporting on the patient?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: No need. See you in an hour or so. Got to... set some stuff up.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Thank you all for coming... to Tribal Council. Man of your integrity, I feel I can trust... Big Love. And I don't call you that because you are a Mormon. So, where's your team's sixth man?

utterance.speaker: COLE
utterance.content: She went rogue. Broke the rules.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You also sinned. You have no right to cast the first stone.

utterance.speaker: COLE
utterance.content: And atheists have no right to quote Scripture.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: The rules said 'no talking'.

utterance.speaker: COLE
utterance.content: I told her not to talk.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Out loud.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: We were trying to save a man's life.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Key word being 'trying'. Tilt table test confirmed that you guys were wrong. You're fired.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Ah, the Prodigal Son returneth. You're also fired.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: We thought there was a tumor on the patient's esophagus. We were right about the area, wrong about the diagnosis. Turns out the esophagus is just straightening. It's scleroderma. It explains the syncope and the choking. He needs steroids.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: You did a CT scan?

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: Obviously.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: After you were already proven wrong?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Good for you. It's too bad you're wrong. Straightening indicates weakening, not hardening. SMA explains the weakening. Strongyloides infection explains everything else. You ladies have the honor to give the patient a feeding tube, discharge him, and show up for work tomorrow. The rest of you... you're a disappointment. You make me want to stop dangling.

utterance.speaker: DOBSON
utterance.content: It was the best two weeks of my life.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I think I will miss you most of all, Ridiculously Old Fraud.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: Do you think House could be wrong?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: I thought he fired you.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: No, he fired the men.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: I don't think he's wrong.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: If he is, how would I prove it?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Just said I don't think he is.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: Well, thinking isn't good enough.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: You'd have to run a blood test for anti-centromere antibodies.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: Would you mind running the labs?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: You can't.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: Well, I can, but...

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: No, I was making a statement. You've been fired, so you no longer have lab privileges. You weren't coming here for advice, you coming here to con a favor to save your job. Sorry. I'm not working for him any more, but he can still make my life miserable.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: You have a chance to make his life miserable.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: I'm insulted. You conned Cameron by appealing to her humanity.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: I told her what she wanted to hear.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: And you told me what you thought I wanted to hear.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: If it's any consolation, I think your motives are more interesting.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: I cannot believe he fired you. Go draw his blood. Meet you in the lab when I'm done here.

utterance.speaker: STARK
utterance.content: Guess you didn't find your tumor?

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: The other doctors tell you that you were fine?

utterance.speaker: STARK
utterance.content: Yeah. In the sense that it's just my disease getting worse. You come to terms with this disease. You know it's there. You know it's waiting. And every now and again, it takes something away.

utterance.speaker: STARK
utterance.content: Took my walking. Took my modesty. Now it's taking one of my last pleasures.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: There's an outside shot that something OTHER than the SMA is causing your eating problems. And if it is, we can fix it. Remove that tube.

utterance.speaker: STARK
utterance.content: That my blood? It's green. What does that mean?

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: It means I'm not fired.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Is he a Vulcan? If no, what makes Nimoy bleed green?

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Are we officially unfired?

utterance.speaker: TWIN 15B
utterance.content: How do we know she didn't fake the green blood?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Because that would be stupid. And while she may be manipulative, borderline evil, shallow...

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: They get it. I'm not stupid.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: What contrast did you use for the CT?

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: ICM.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: His kidneys aren't working. They didn't filter the contrast, which in ICM, is green.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Ten points. 'k... let's add kidney failure to our list of symptoms.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: What are these points? Is that how you're deciding who to fire?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I'm going to fire the next person who asks me who I'm going to fire.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Now we're on the points system? What happened to Men against Women?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Forget the game.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: What do you mean forget the game?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I mean, forget the damn game! Guy's kidneys are failing. We need to diagnose exactly...

utterance.speaker: DOBSON
utterance.content: I thought we were diagnosing.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: YOU were diagnosing. Now I am too. I thought that Thirteen was right about the Strongyloides. I was obviously wrong. Okay, kidney failure, aspiration, fainting... go!

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: Kidney failure could be the result of a Gram-negative bacteria. Our patient wears a catheter full-time. It virtually guarantees bacterial infection.

utterance.speaker: TWIN 15B
utterance.content: Which could have migrated up to his kidneys.

utterance.speaker: TWIN 15A
utterance.content: Infection stresses his already weakened system, makes his SMA worse, that explains the choking and fainting.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Put him on IV Ampigen.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: Our team's scleroderma diagnosis still holds. The test could have been negative because the blood was contaminated with contrast.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Do a skin biopsy. Get a side of lymph node to confirm.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I could have you fired!

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: You've already had me fired.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Which proves that I can.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Were the men wrong?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: No. That doesn't change the fact...

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Why are you yelling at me?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Because performing tests for someone who is not a doctor in this hospital...

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: You're frustrated. If you want help, I'm here. If you just need to vent... leave a message.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: I like him better like this. You?

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: Patient developed pneumonia. His lungs are filling fast. We started him on antibiotics. Nothing. We were wrong.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: And you're here to say?

utterance.speaker: BRENNAN
utterance.content: We were wrong too. He doesn't have scleroderma. Biopsy revealed no fibrotic changes.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Cervical lymph node has black flecks.

utterance.speaker: BRENNAN
utterance.content: Small areas of necrosis. It's nothing.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You say nothing? I say cancer.

utterance.speaker: SCHAFFER
utterance.content: It's a bit of a stretch to jump right to cancer.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: I'm not jumping. Broad specs haven't worked, so it's not bacterial. Failing liver despite treatment suggests it's not fungal. And her high lactic acidosis points towards anaplastic large cell lymphoma.

utterance.speaker: SCHAFFER
utterance.content: Also suggests infection. Which is a lot easier and safer to treat.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Large cell lymphoma's incredibly aggressive. She'll be dead in a week if we follow the textbooks.

utterance.speaker: SCHAFFER
utterance.content: Unless it's infection, in which case you radiate her and she'll be dead in a day. And I know you've had some experience with that. I've seen doctors do this before. Go back to the scene of the crime - if you're right this time, you purge yourself of past ghosts.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: I know it's contrary to protocol. But I think it's more like...

utterance.speaker: SCHAFFER
utterance.content: Ghosts are there for a reason. So you don't make the same mistake twice. Switch her over to third-generation cephalosporin.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: You want to remove his EYE?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Who told you?

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: You booked the OR.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Good.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: You can't beat me in a foot race.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Thought we were dancing.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Cervical lymph node is a garbage dump. A very small one. Just one truck comes in and it only comes from one home. Al Gore would be appalled. The home...

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: The home is the right eye. I get it. Do a biopsy.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: On my way.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: You're not DOING a biopsy. You ordered an orbital exenteration.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Right. Because I don't want to remove a little tiny piece, sit in a lab, and confirm what I already know, while my patient drowns in his own fluid. But if you want me to, I absolutely will.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: How advanced is the pneumonia?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: It's taking college courses. Hey, Wilson! I'm going to cut some cripple's eye out! Want to come watch?

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Good times.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: We good to go?

utterance.speaker: STARK
utterance.content: I thought melanoma was skin cancer.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Technically, it's cancer of the pigment cells, the same cells that give your iris its color.

utterance.speaker: STARK
utterance.content: Cancer. Why not? What else can God throw at me?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Hail. Locusts. Smiting of the firstborn. Course, it all depends on how evil you've been.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: House.

utterance.speaker: STARK
utterance.content: If it's cancer, it's spread everywhere, right? It's what's in my lungs, my kidneys?

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: There is a chance, by removing the eye, get the primary tumor, and three courses of radiation, that could...

utterance.speaker: STARK
utterance.content: Could? What? Few months? Years?

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: More likely months.

utterance.speaker: STARK
utterance.content: Any of your other doctors have any cheerier diagnoses?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: If they do, they're wrong. This is the answer. It's the only way to help you.

utterance.speaker: STARK
utterance.content: I already can't walk. I can't eat. You're telling me that the rest of my life... is in this bed... puking and in pain?

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: We can manage the pain.

utterance.speaker: STARK
utterance.content: I'd rather just get this over with. I've been trapped... in this useless body long enough. It'd be nice to finally get out.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Get out and go where? You think you're gonna sprout wings and start flying around with the other angels? Don't be an idiot. There is no 'after', there's just 'this'.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: House!

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: You can't let a dying man take solace in his beliefs.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: His beliefs are stupid.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Everybody lies. Some for good reasons, some for bad. This would have been a fantastic reason to lie!

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Hi! Greg House.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Why can't you just let him have his fairy tale? If it give him comfort to imagine beaches and loved ones and life outside a wheelchair....

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Are there 72 virgins too?

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: It's over. He's got days, maybe hours left. What pain does it cause you if he spends that time with a peaceful smile? What sick pleasure do you get in making damn sure he's filled with fear and dread?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: He shouldn't be making a decision based on a lie. Misery is better than nothing.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: You don't KNOW there's nothing. You haven't been there.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Oh, God, I am TIRED of that argument! I don't have to go to Detroit to know that it smells.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Yes. Detroit. The Afterlife. Same thing.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: You're not getting enough oxygen, so we're inserting a tube directly into your lungs. It should help us drain some of this excess fluid.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: Should make you a little more comfortable.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: Sats are still dropping.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: The fluid's clear. If this was cancer, there should be blood. Call House.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: He just paged me.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: Dr. House!

utterance.speaker: COLE
utterance.content: Maybe it was... just an accident.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: It wasn't an accident.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Think his nihilism got the best of him and he tried to kill himself?

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: He paged me.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: He paged you?

utterance.speaker: TWIN 15A
utterance.content: Why you?

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: I assume because he...

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Don't assume anything.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Don't fall into that trap.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: Is he okay?

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Burned his hand pretty good. His heart stopped for nearly a minute. But your cohort managed to... restart it. But... he has not regained consciousness. So... since I have you all here, we should probably talk about your ACTUAL patient.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Clear fluid from the lungs indicates that it's probably not cancer, so it would be nice if we could come up with a new idea.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: You're an idiot. You nearly killed yourself.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: That was the whole idea.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: You WANTED to kill yourself?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I wanted to NEARLY kill myself. Is he... better?

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: No. But he doesn't have cancer. We think it might be eosinophilic pneumonia. Maybe you didn't want to die, but you didn't care if you lived.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You insisted that I needed to see for myself.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: What, was he discharged?

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: No. He's dying. You've already had two near-death experiences.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Not that guy. The guy in the car accident. With the knife. I... I need to talk to him.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: He... died almost an hour ago. Apparently, it's bad to electrocute yourself within days of suffering massive internal injuries. Why did you need to talk to him? Did you... see... something?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Eosinophilic pneumonia...

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: House? What did you see?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Nothing. Who's idea was that?

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Brennan. Nothing-you-don't-want-to-talk-about-it or nothing...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Which one's Brennan? Is he the ridiculously old guy?

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: House, you gotta talk about this.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: If it's aggressive enough, it might have gotten past the steroids. Start him on cyclophosphamide.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: I already did. Just looking at you hurts. I'm going to order up some extra pain meds.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I love you.

utterance.speaker: STARK
utterance.content: How fast... will this work?

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: New meds should start helping in minutes. Just hang in there.

utterance.speaker: JODY
utterance.content: Vacutainer's full. I need to replace it.

utterance.speaker: STARK
utterance.content: I don't... I don't think it... it's working.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: Try and relax.

utterance.speaker: STARK
utterance.content: You must... you must be wr... wrong.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: Stop talking. Hurry up and get that chest tube working?

utterance.speaker: JODY
utterance.content: Okay. I got it.

utterance.speaker: STARK
utterance.content: Could you get... Hoover?

utterance.speaker: STARK
utterance.content: I can't... Can you... put my... hand... on his head?

utterance.speaker: STARK
utterance.content: It's okay. Don't worry. I'm not scared.

utterance.speaker: JODY
utterance.content: Oh, God.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: Time of death...

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: You're looking better. Stark's dead.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Going to see our patient.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: He's dead.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Dead is not a diagnosis.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: You really shouldn't be...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Shut up. And give me my cane.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: I assume we're all fired.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Should I fire myself, too? I thought it was Strongyloides, then I thought it was cancer. Little help here.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: Ready? One, two...

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: Why'd you call me?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Because if I pooped myself in front of Wilson, I'd never hear the end of it.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: But why not one of the others?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You always had that phone in your hand.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: We all have cell phones. That's not the reason. What is?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: If I died, you'd never get the job. I knew you wouldn't let that happen.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: You don't think anybody else has any reason to care?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Think this is starting to come back to me. Right, left, then repeat.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Yeah, that works.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: What did we miss?

utterance.speaker: JODY
utterance.content: If we knew, he wouldn’t be dead.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: So, that's it? You're just gonna give up?

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: No. We were defeated. It's over.

utterance.speaker: JODY
utterance.content: Patient presented with syncope. We thought it was threadworms, gave him ivermectin.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Thank you. Patient seemed... better, 'til his blood turned green.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: Can we at least remove the body before launching into a purely academic exercise?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: The patient didn't respond to antibiotics or steroids.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: You okay, boy?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: What's wrong with the dog?

utterance.speaker: JODY
utterance.content: He's dead. There are only a handful of viruses that can cross between dogs and humans, but they may not be connected at all. The dog was old. I've seen it before. They hang on way past their normal life expectancy to take care of their masters.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Did you watch him take the pills? The ivermectin. Did you watch the patient put them in his mouth and swallow them?

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: I don't know. I think so.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: What kind of dog is that?

utterance.speaker: JODY
utterance.content: English Shepherd.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: It's in the Collie family, right?

utterance.speaker: JODY
utterance.content: Not really.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: They share the MDR-1 gene.

utterance.speaker: JODY
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: What happens when you give a dog with the MDR-1 gene ivermectin?

utterance.speaker: JODY
utterance.content: They don't. I mean, it's used to treat heartworms in most dogs, but it'd be fatal if the...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Look familiar? I think the last time you saw it, it didn't have that dead dog's teethmarks on it.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: I just put it on the bed tray to get him some water.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: When I asked you if you watched the patient swallow the pills, the right answer was 'no'. Take his body down to the morgue.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: If you hadn't treated this patient as a game, he wouldn't be dead.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Feeling much better, thank you.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: I'm supposed to show you sympathy? He died... while his attending was lying on a hospital bed because he stuck a knife in a wall socket.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: He died because a doctor made a mistake. He was an idiot.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: You employed her. You're responsible.

utterance.speaker: SCHAFFER
utterance.content: Dr. Foreman.

utterance.speaker: SCHAFFER
utterance.content: How's she doing?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Fever's gone. AST and ALT are back within normal range. She should be out of here in a few days.

utterance.speaker: SCHAFFER
utterance.content: Gutsy call.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: SCHAFFER
utterance.content: It wasn't a compliment. If you were wrong, she'd be dead.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: I was sure...

utterance.speaker: SCHAFFER
utterance.content: No, you weren't. You couldn't be. There's a reason we have rules. If every doctor did whatever his 'gut' told him was right, we'd have a lot more dead bodies to deal with.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: It won't happen again.

utterance.speaker: SCHAFFER
utterance.content: Yes, it will. Because you confused saving her life with doing the right thing. I'm sorry, Dr. Foreman, you're fired.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: As soon as the pathologist cut into the lungs, we saw the threadworms.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You think it's fair that I fired all the other members of your team when you guys actually came up with the right diagnosis?

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: I keep replaying it in my mind. Did I drop the pills when I put them on the bed tray? Did I knock them over when I turned to leave?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You know he'd be alive.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: His dog'd be alive.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You forced us to act on a false assumption.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Everything we built from that step on. Every test. Every theory. Every treatment.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: I know! Forget the lecture and fire me already!

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: If I was going to fire you, I wouldn't be giving you the lecture. I know you're not going to let anything like this ever happen again. I'll see you tomorrow.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: And I'm sorry to say... I told you so.
